Well it does in my case .

My code is right, the GitHub's eliminates the backquotes .

Please notice the new result *IS *different .
attached picture .

On 14 April 2016 at 08:30, Nigel Vickers <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Checking that groups doesn't eat back ticks
> type base struct {
> Id int64 `json:"id"`
> Mes `json:"mes"`
> }
>
>
> On 14 April 2016 at 06:22, Faisal Dirie A <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
> > This is not a bug.
> > Try to wrap the back qoute in json:"id" and json:"mes", and you get the
> > correct response of [2,1]
> >
> > here is the playground code. https://play.golang.org/p/UdK00l6qgZ
> >
> > —
> > You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/15273#issuecomment-209755310>
>
> >
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
